p: The main pathologic changes observed consistently in almost all diseased ducks were found in the ovaries: hyperemia, hemorrhage, degeneration, distortion, macrophage and lymphocyte infiltration, and hyperplasia; in the liver, interstitial inflammation was found in the portal area ( Figure 1, panels Aâ€“C). On the basis of these changes, the disease was designated duck hemorrhagic ovaritis.
